description:
Whether understanding and solving online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Hardware Customer Care team is on the frontlines of enhancing the customer experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in program management within the risk management space, including risk management, risk assessment, risk reporting, audit, compliance and/or incident management.
  • 2 years of experience in compliance management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with vendors, third-party operations and risk management.
  • Basic understanding and knowledge of customer sales and support security concepts (e.g., access management).
  • Ability to work well in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment and develop solutions to problems with unclear guidelines.
responsibilities:
• Be the point of contact for Google Devices and Services (GD&S) Customer Care risk and compliance.
  • Identify and assess risks that may hinder the reputation, safety, security, and business continuity of the GD&S organization and its delivery to Google customers. Prioritize and implement necessary projects to reduce overall risk.
  • Create and implement processes, procedures, and policies to drive continual risk management planning, including comprehensive identification, detailed evaluation, and mitigation of major risks.
  • Partner closely with functional owners within Customer Care and cross-functional partners like GD&S global risk management, Legal, Finance, and Product Area leadership. Collaborate with mitigation plan owners to prevent risk realization.
  • Identify compliance gaps within Customer Care organization and develop mitigation strategies. Serve as subject matter expert within Customer Care organization for all compliance related projects and requirements.
title: Risk and Compliance Manager, Hardware Customer Care
